bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 165, Number 108 (Wednesday, June 26, 2019)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. PERRY:H.J. Res. 71.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article V[Page H5202]

Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.

item.name: Presidents and presidential powers, Vice Presidents

summary.text: This joint resolution proposes a constitutional amendment requiring congressional approval of agency regulations for which one-fourth of the membership of either chamber of Congress has signed a petition disapproving of such regulation.

bill.title: Proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States to require legislative approval for certain regulations.

item.title: Proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States to require legislative approval for certain regulations.
Proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States to require legislative approval for certain regulations.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
